column4: Is there any program on ubuntu vanilla install that'll play movies ?
does ubuntu come with a movie player ?
enable the rights debs and add in vlc, i'm not sure if it's available on default debs or not,,
he doesn't have the internet ...
if they're newb to linux, or ubuntu in general, try something like easyubuntu or i dunno, havn't tried that automatix thing, but that either
I don't see how that's going to help to be honest with you. He still won't have the internet ;-)
sorry, didn't catch your comment on the no internet first time round
remember, it's freedom
to quote some anoying american fellah,,, "the price of freedom is eternal vigialnce"
freedom for what ? to waste my time with an overly tempremental system ?
just cause you run servers doesn't mean you know didly :)
i run 7 or 8 servers at the moment,, all linux, and i donn't know crap!!!
that's the beauty of linux :)
at least there are resolutions to these problems
try getting a program bug worked out in windows when your not the devloper... hah!

right. It's not just me though. This is my fourth irc post, and I've had two ubuntuforums post. I'm used to dealing with linux 'issues' but this one takes the biscuit. And nobody knows how to help ...
azureus ralted issue?
no - ubuntu related issue ...
sorry, explain to me one more time, i've had the ocasional issue with azureus and it is usually to do with the java install
ahh, ok, what is the issue exactly? i missed it.
yeah, it just worked for me too until I tried to plug into the wireless network at the local supermarket ...
